trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> objects.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> class for the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref>.
Only the properties that are listed in the string array are initialized.
The print server that hosts the collection.
The properties of the collection members that are initialized.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> class for the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintServer"></xref>, containing only the print server's queues of the specified <xref href="System.Printing.EnumeratedPrintQueueTypes"></xref>.
Only the properties that are listed in the string array are initialized.
The print server that hosts the collection.
The properties of the collection members that are initialized.
An array that specifies the types of print queues that are included in the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> to the collection.
The print queue that is added.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are being used by the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref>, and optionally releases the managed resources that are being used.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the unnamed Boolean parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with the parameter set to `false`.
When the Boolean parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources that are held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
To be added.
Returns an object that implements the generic <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface that has been closed with <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
We recommend that you use the `foreach` statement to iterate through all members of the collection.
Use GetEnumerator only when you need to customize iteration, such as by skipping every other member.

An object that implements the generic <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> and that can iterate through the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> objects that the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> contains.
Gets an object that implements the non-generic <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.
We recommend that you use the `foreach` statement to iterate through all members of the collection.
Use your own enumerator object only when you need to customize iteration, such as by skipping every other member.
If you need your own enumerator, we recommend that you use the generic, type-safe function <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> instead of GetNonGenericEnumerator.
The GetNonGenericEnumerator is public only to fulfill the requirements of the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface, which is implemented by this collection.

An object that implements the non-generic <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> and that can iterate through the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> objects that the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref> contains.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueCollection"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Object> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
